alert.note: Alert for Tooele (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 6:53PM MDT until August 10 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Jacob City Burn Scar in... Eastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 945 PM MDT. * At 653 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Jacob City Burn Scar. Between 0.3 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flows moving through the Soldier Canyon crossing the county road. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Jacob City Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Eastern Tooele County east of Stockton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
